Wondugo irin leepolji suddugo yeeso feere ɗon feelama ha lesɗe be berniji feere bana dabareji ustugo sallinol ha kunde ummatore.
There are worldwide shortages of surgical masks.
Ha nder duniyaru fu, wodi ustol leepolji suddugo yeeso ha do lumo.
If you do wear a mask, make sure to use it correctly.
To a ɗon ɓorni leepol suddugo yeeso, ɓornu ɗum be boɗɗum.
The mask should cover your nose and mouth and fit without gaps.
Leepol suddugo yeeso ndu sey sudda kine be hunduko ma bila accugo baabal.
Wash your hands before putting on the mask and avoid touching the mask while wearing it.
Lallu juɗe ma hiddeko ɓornugo mask e ta memmu mask to a ɓorni ɗum timmi.
If you do touch it, wash your hands immediately afterwards.
To a memmi ɗum, lallu juɗe ma lau ha ɓawo man.
When the mask becomes damp, discard and replace it.
To leepol suudugo yeeso soffi, ittu e saanju ɗum
Remove it from the back, throw it away, and then wash your hands.
Ittu ndu gal ɓawo, sakkinu ɗum, ha ɓawo man lallu juɗe maɗa.
Remember that masks are not a substitute for good hygiene: continue to wash your hands frequently.
Sifturu yo'o leepolji suddugo yeeso yiɗa wi'ugo ta on laɓɓina: tokkitu lallugo juɗe ha wakati fu.
Don't stock up on masks if you don't need them.
Ta moftu maskji ha suudu to a maray haaje man.
Mask shortages mean that healthcare workers are having trouble getting a hold of masks, which puts everyone at risk.
Ustol maskji yiɗi wi'ugo yo'o huwooɓe do jam ɓaandu ɗon mari saɗirma keɓɓugo maskji, je ɗon wata ko moy fu nder sababu.
That includes N95 respirators, which are not recommended for the general public – these are specialist equipment which must be fitted to be optimally effective.
Ndu larni ordoji N95, je feelakke ngam ummatore, ndu woni kujeji huwooɓe do jam ɓaandu je wondan je maɓɓe ngam huwidugo be man.
Leave them for healthcare workers.
Acce ɗum ha huwooɓe do jam ɓaandu.
Avoid crowded areas, especially enclosed areas without much air circulation, such as conferences, performances, shopping malls, public transportation, and religious services.
Luttu wakkereji je ɗon mofti ummatore, ɓurna bo'o wakkereji je ɗon maɓɓi e hendu salla ha ton boɗɗum, bana hawtirolji, sappinolji, cuuɗi sippol maungel, hortol ummatore, be deewalji dina'en.
Events which involve a large scale gathering of people, from religious pilgrimages to music concerts, are being canceled worldwide, in an effort to contain the spread of the virus.
Kuɗe je larni mofturde yimɓe jur, diga ngilli dina'en ha mofturde gimmolji, darnotto ha nder duniyaru fu, ngam dabare darnugo sankittol viriis.
Tourist attractions, businesses, and transportation may be closed, especially in affected countries.
Baabe ngilli, filluji, hortolji footi maɓɓa, ɓurna fu ha nder lesɗe je ɗon mari nyau man.
Some canceled events, especially performances, sporting events, and classes, are being moved online, which means you can experience them without traveling.
Kuɗe feere je darnama, bana sappinolji, kuɗe espor, be jaangirdeji, sey sallotto do hawo, je yiɗi wi'ugo footi a waɗa mala lara ndu bila jaahangal.
At petrol/gas stations, use gloves or wipe down the handle with a disinfectant wipe if you can.
Ha baabe sippugo neebam/kalanjiir, huwe be kujeji suddugo juɗe e laɓɓine ɗum be kuje laɓɓugo to a footi.
After filling up, clean your hands with hand sanitizer.
To a hebbini, laɓɓinu juɗe ma be kuje laɓɓugo juɗe.
The U.S. and Canadian governments recommend avoiding travel by cruise ship.
Ngomna'en Lesɗe America be Kanada ɗon feela luttugo jaahangal be kombeewol ngilli.
Infections spread easily on board, and medical care is limited.
Nyauji ɗon sankitta law do man, be suklare do jam ɓaandu.
Amid a cruise ship outbreak, quarantines and docking are challenging partly due to the large number of people aboard.
Ha cakka nyau je salli do kombeewal ngilli, wondugo ha seera be jippinugo yimɓe ɗon saɗi ngam yimɓe ɗuɗɗi nder ton.

Even cruise ships without confirmed cases have been denied permission to dock due to virus fears, and in the high-profile case of the Diamond Princess in Japan, hundreds of people were infected on the ship.
Ko kombeewolji ngilli je maray nyauɗo je ɗon aandi ɓe sallini ɓe jarfuye jippol ngam hullol viriis, be sababu je salli be Diamond Princess ha Japan, je mari no nyau
If you believe you may be infected, call a hospital or local emergency medical services instead of going in person to avoid infecting others.
To a tammi footi a raɓɓi nyau, ewnu suudu lekki mala kuɗe jaawal jam ɓaandu do yahugo be hoore maɗa ngam ta a raɓɓa yimɓe feere.
Mention your symptoms and travel history.
Matinu mandolji nyu ma be tariya jaahangal ma.
Wear a medical mask and follow the instructions of authorities and doctors.
Watu mask jam ɓaandu e tokkitu mandolji yimɓe ngomna be jam ɓaandu.
See also: Flight and health
Laru bo'o: Fiirol be jam ɓaandu
On a plane, follow the same hygiene practices as anywhere else: wash hands frequently, or use alcohol-based hand sanitizer if it's not convenient to leave your seat, and avoid touching your face.
Ha nder pireewol, tokkitu irin dabare laɓɓinol ndu bana ha toy fu: lallu juɗe ma ha wakati fu, mala kuje laɓɓinugo juɗe je mari alkol to a feecay ummugo do koorowal maɗa, e ta memmu yeeso maɗa.
Researchers have found that passengers in window seats have less risk of contact with sick people.
Teffooɓe tawi yo'o sallooɓe je wondi ha dammuɗe ɗon mari sababu je lessi ngam hawtugo be nyauɓe.
Try to book a window seat, and avoid moving around the cabin during the flight.
Suɓɓe jonde ha dammugal, e ta wancu nder pireewol ha wakati fiirol.
After washing your hands and before sitting down, use disinfectant wipes to wipe down the area around your seat.
Ha ɓawo lallugo juɗe moɗon e hiddeko on joɗɗa, hoose leepolji ustugo ngam laɓɓinugo wakkere je ɗon tardi koorowal.
Wipe hard surfaces, and if your seat is leather you can wipe that too.
Ustu daaldalji, to koorowal ma ɗon be laaral you footi usta ndu bo'o.
Don't wipe a cloth seat, as the moisture can make transmission easier.
Ta ustu koorowal limse, ngam sofnol footi wartira sallinol koyɗum.
When using disinfectant wipes, follow the instructions on the packaging.
Ha wakati huwidugo be kuje ustugo, tokkitu matinolji je ɗon windi do ɓawo man.
And remember, viruses enter through your mouth, nose, and eyes – wiping down the area doesn't hurt, but it's not a substitute for proper hygiene.
E siftoru yo'o, viriisji ɗon nasta gal hunduko, kine, be gite, ustugo wakkere nawata, amma wonay bana ko ɗon woylatta laɓɓinol.
Wash your hands and avoid touching your face.
Lallu juɗe maɗa e ta memmu yeeso maɗa.
And use a tissue to touch the touch screen or other controls.
E hoosu leepol ngam memmugo telefon mala kujeji ordo feere.
When using the lavatory, use paper towels to turn off the faucet and open the door, then throw them away.
Ha wakati yahugo ha gaɗɗa suudu, hoosu takkarde gaɗɗa suudu ngam maɓɓugo ndiyam be maɓɓitugo dammugal, ha ɓawo man sakkinu ɗum.
Airlines in affected areas are taking steps to reduce transmission and keep passengers safe.
Fiirolji ha wakkereji je ɗon memmi ɗon waɗa yaɓɓordeji ngam ustugo sallinol heɓɓa sallooɓe wonda jam.
For instance, these may include cleaning facilities more frequently, allowing flight attendants to wear masks, and serving prepackaged instead of freshly heated meals.
Bana sappinol, footi en ɓesda laɓɓinol wakkere ha wakati fu, je hokkatta jarfuye ha sukloɓe do jam ɓaandu ɓorna maskji, e je hokkata nyamdu je taskama timmi do nyamɗe je ɓe wulli tan.

If a group of passengers is connecting from an area with a severe outbreak, the flight attendants may be able to seat them away from the rest of the passengers (and if you were recently in a high-risk area, consider telling the flight attendants for this reason).

To geeɓe sallooɓe ɗon salla diga wakkere je ɗon mari nyau ndu be sembe, huwooɓe piirol ndu footi watta ɓe ha seera dayi be sallooɓe feere (e to ɗon warta no wakkere je ɗon sababu jur, matine huwooɓe piirol ngam majuum).
You may be prohibited from changing seats on the flight.
Footi ɓe haɗɗa ma ngam saanjogo koorowal ha nder pireewol.
This is so that, if someone on the flight turns out to be infected, the authorities can track down the people who were sitting near them for testing or quarantine.
Ndu bana, to goɗɗo ha nder pireewol ndu woni bana mari nyau, yimɓe nomna footi lorta ngam teffugo yimɓe je wondi no be mako ngam lartugo ɓe mala wondugo ha seera.
COVID-19 is treated by relieving symptoms and preventing complications.
COVID-19 hurgotto gal ustugo manndolji be aynugo saɗirmaji.
There is no vaccine or specific treatment for the novel coronavirus.
Wala baatal mala hurgol je feerejo je hurgatta koronaviriis keese ndu.
Research into a vaccine or specific antiviral drug is underway.
Teffol ngam baatal mala lekki je footi hurga ɗum ɗon do lawol.
There are a variety of trials using HIV medications and other novel antiviral medications for treatment of COVID-19.
Wodi foondolji feere-feere be lekki HIV be lekki je mbaratta viriisji feere ngam hugugo COVID-19.
Mild symptoms may be relieved by taking paracetamol (acetaminophen).
Mandolji je deydey tan footi ustama gal hoosugo paracetamol (acetaminophen).
If you are infected with COVID-19, countries will isolate you until several consecutive tests for COVID-19 are negative.
To a mari COVID-19, lesɗeji wattan mon ha seera ha lartolji do moɗon je ɗon tokkiti sappina yo'o on maray nyau ndu.
If you have been in close contact with someone infected with COVID-19, many countries will quarantine you for 14 days since the last exposure and monitor you for signs and symptoms.
To wondi no be goɗɗo je mari nyau COVID-19, lesɗe jur wattan mon ha seera nder balɗe 14 diga ragare wakati sababu e ayna mon to on sappinan mandolji nyau man.
Some countries will also test you even if you don't have symptoms.
Lesɗe feere lartan mon bo'o ko to on maray mandolji nyau.

In many countries, the healthcare system has been stretched to the point of not being able to handle the sheer number of patients, and there is a chance you may be refused treatment due to the lack of available medical staff, supplies or equipment.

Ha nder lesɗe ɗuɗɗum, dabare jam ɓaandu ɓesdama ha gaɗɗa e waɗa yo'o footay ma ɓe jaɓɓitta limtol nyauɓe tan, wodi sa'a je ɓa salla hurgugo mon ngam wala yimɓe jam ɓaandu je footi sukla do moɗon, kujeji be ordoji.
Many countries have shut down or severely limited flights, ships, and border crossings, especially to and from affected areas.
Lesɗe jur maɓɓi mala usti fiirolji, kombeewalji, be ta'ittugo keerolji be ɗuɗɗum, ɓurnaa fu yahugo be wurtugo wakkereji je ɗon mari nnau ndu.

Even more countries have imposed restrictions on arriving travelers, either barring entry (maybe with an exception for local citizens and permanent residents) or requiring you to be quarantined, typically for 14 days.

Lesɗe jur usti mala darni nastirde yimɓe jaahangal je yotti, gal haɗɗugo nastugo (temma be sa'a ha yimɓe lesdi mala je maru jarfuye wondugo ha lesdi ndi) mala emman non ngam wondugo seera, ɓurna fu ha nder balɗe 14.
Even if a mandatory quarantine is not imposed, you may be asked to "self-quarantine" by staying at home and not interacting with other people.
Ko to wondugo seera wonay dole, footi a emmotto a wona seera "be hoore ma" gal wondugo ha saare e a wala fottugo be yimɓe feere.
The most severe restrictions are on travellers who have recently been to affected areas, but increasingly many countries are applying them to incoming travellers overall.
Darnollji je ɓuri tullugo ɗon do yimɓe je waɗi jaahangal be ɓawo ndu ha nder wakkereji je ɗon mari nyau, amma bo'o lessɗe jur ɗon ɓesda wattugo ndu ha sallooɓe je ɗon nsata.
Some countries have even prohibited all or almost all foreigners from entry or limited the ability of local citizens and residents to leave.
Lesɗe feere haɗɗi hoɗɓe fu mala ɓurna fu ngam nastugo mala usti dabare yimɓe lesdi be wondooɓe dila.
What are the affected areas?
Wakkere toy lati ɗon raɓɓi?
Well, this is a fast-changing situation, and each country/region/organization has its own list of what areas are subject to restrictions.
To, kuje man je ɗon sanja be lau ndu, be kala lesdi/wakkere/geeɓe ɗn mari wakkereji je ɗon mari darnolji.
The city of Wuhan is on every list and the rest of mainland China is on most.
Berniwol Wuhan lati ha do limtol ko moy fu be lesdi Cayna ɓurna fu.

Other areas that are often included: France, Germany, Hong Kong, Iran, Italy, Japan, Macau, Singapore, South Korea, Spain, Taiwan, the United Kingdom, the United States, the Schengen Area as a whole, and sometimes various others.
Wakkereji feere larni: Faraansa, Jaamani, Hong Kong, Iran, Italy, Japan, Macau, Singapore, South Korea, Spain, Taiwan, Lesɗe Inglisiya, Lesɗe America, Wakkere Schengen fu, ha yakke feere be feere'en.
Some countries have imposed restrictions based on citizenship or residency from severely affected areas.
Lesɗe feere jo'ini darnolji do wonde jeeya
A detailed list of entry restrictions is maintained by the IATA.
Limtol nastirde je ɗon darni wondi ha IATA.
It doesn't cover all the restrictions, but it's still useful.
Larnay darnolji fu, amma ɗon naffa bo'o.
Keep up to date—the outbreak and the travel restrictions are changing rapidly.
Famme bo'o wakati, nyau be darnolji do jaahangal ɗon saanje law.
For travel in the near future, consider making refundable reservations in case the changing situation forces you to change your plans.
Ngam waɗɗugo jaahande ha nder balɗe je warango, numme do wa
Avoid buying tickets with a connection in an affected area – even changing planes can make you subject to restrictions.
Ta sodde batakkewol jaahangal gal wakkere je ɗon mari nyau, ko saanjol pireewolji ma footi mara darnolji.

Flights may get canceled with little notice, either due to the disease's spread and ever-changing entry restrictions, or simply because fewer people are flying and airlines are having trouble filling seats.

Fiirolji footi willake be batakkewol seeɗa ni, to ngam sankittol nyau be dabareji nastirde je ɗon saanja tum, mala ngam yimɓe seeɗa tan ɗon fiira e geeɓeji hortolji ɗon mari larulaji hebbinugo pireewol.
You might also be delayed for hours upon arrival waiting for temperature checks and related procedures and paperwork, or even get quarantined for two weeks.
Footi bo'o ɓe ɗaayina mon nder njamɗe ha yottol ngam lartol wullol ɓaandu be laahalji e ɗereji, mala bo'o watta mon ha seera nder asawere ɗiɗi.
Be prepared for the possibility of disruption to your travel plans, especially if traveling internationally.
Taske ngam footi jaahargal jaahangal moɗon darnotto, bana to on ɗon wurta ha lesdi feere.
Even if you're nowhere near affected areas there's a risk that you'll have to stay at the destination longer than planned if you've shared a building or vessel with an infected person.
Ko to on meeɗay wondugo ha wakkere je ɗon mari nyau wodi sababu joɗɗugo ha wakkere ndu he gaɗɗa ko on hasdi to a don nder suudu be goɗɗo mala dabare hortol be mo je ɗon mari nyau.
For example, in late February an Italian doctor on vacation in Costa Adeje (Canary Islands) was diagnosed with COVID-19, and as a result all the guests in the hotel he stayed at were quarantined.
Bana sappinol, ha ragare Feviriye wodi lekkitajo Itali feere do siwtare ha Costa Adeje (Canary Islands) je larti bana mari nyau COVID-19, e bana ni yimɓe fu je wondi ha hotel mako joɗɗi fu ha seera.
Lockdowns and other internal restrictions
Wondugo ha saare be darnolji je nder feere

Some countries and regions, especially severely affected ones, are implementing emergency lockdowns and restrictions on people's movements and activities, even for those who haven't recently been abroad.
Lesɗe feere be wakkereji, ɓurna fu je nyau man nyaɗi ha ton , ɗon wangina wondugo ha saare be darnolji ngam jaawal do wancuru be kuɗe ummatore, ko je yimɓe je wurtay yaasi neeɓay sam.

These include the temporary reintroduction of some border controls, restrictions on travel within the country, closing or limiting service at restaurants and other establishments, banning large public events, and in the most severe cases prohibiting people from leaving the house except for essential reasons.
Ndu larni nastinol aynolji ha keerol, darnolji do jaahangal nder lesdi, maɓɓol mala ustol kuɗe cuuɗi yamɗe mala cuuɗi kugal, darnol kuɗe ummatore ngam wurtugo saare sna to wodi naffuda uja man.
Beyond government restrictions, individual establishments are shutting their doors and cancelling events to try to reduce the spread of the virus.
Ha ɓawo darnolji ngomna, cuuɗi kugal feerejo maɓɓotto dammuɗe maɓɓe be darnugo kuɗe ngam ustugo sankittol viriis.
In China, there are extensive restrictions on transportation and activity, which vary widely by province, city, and even by district or village.
Ha Cayna, wodi darnolji ɗuɗɗum do hortol br kujeji, je ɗon saanja be lamarorde, berniwol e be distrik mala wuro fu.
Many governments recommend against traveling to China at this time.
Ngomna'en jur ɗon feela ta on waɗa jaahangal ha Cayna.
If you have no choice, do your research and get up-to-date information about the local situation wherever you are going.
To a wala dabare feere, waɗu teffol e hoosu matinolji je jonta do ko ɗon salla ha nder wakkere man ko toy fu je a ɗon yaha.
People who have traveled to Hubei face particularly severe restrictions.
Yimɓe je waɗi jaahangal ha Hubei ɗon mari haɗɗolji je ɓuri tullugo.
Examples of restrictions that you may encounter in some parts of China (this is not an exhaustive list):
Sappinolji haɗɗolji je footi on heɓɓa ha wakkere Cayna feere (ndu limtay fu ha do bo'o):
14-day quarantine, self-quarantine, or COVID-19 test upon arrival from other parts of China or from other countries, at your expense
Wondugo ha seera ha nder balɗe 14, wondugo ha seera be hoore moɗon, mala lartol COVID-19 ha yottol moɗon to on ummi wakkereji Cayna feere mala lesɗe feere, je nyau man woni ha ton, be ceede maɗa.
questions about your travel and medical history (lying can get you years in prison)
emmolji do tariya jaahangal maɗa be jam ɓaandu maɗa (feewugo go hoora ma ha nder suudu fursina e salla duɓɓi ha ton)
mandatory registration using an online or paper form
windugo inde je dole gal hawo mala do batakkewol
requirement to wear a face mask in public
ewnandu ngam ɓornugo mask suudugo yeese ha cakka ummatore
people who have been outside of China within 14 days not allowed into public places like malls
yimɓe je wondi ha yaasi Cay nder balɗe 14 wala jarfuye wondugo ha wakkere ummatore bana suddu fillu je manga
shops only accept mobile payments, not cash
sey sodda kujeji gal ordo, ceede jaɓɓatakke
restaurants, transportation and other establishments refusing service to non-Chinese citizens
cuuɗi nyamɗe, hortol be cuuɗi kuɗe feere wallatta yimɓe feere je wonay jeeyaɓe Cayna
many forms of transportation reduced or shut down
dabareji horol ɗuɗɗum usti mala maɓɓi
mandatory real-name registration for public transit cards
windugo inde be dule ngam karte sallugo ummatore
access in and out of a town, village, or city completely blocked
nastol be wurtol berniwol, wuro, mala berni darnakke fu
non-resident visitors prohibited from entering apartment complexes
ngilloɓe je wonday ha lesdi ndu haɗɗakke ngam nastugo ha cuuɗi feere
only allowed to go outside once every two days to get supplies
mari jarfuye wurtugo nde gooto ha nder balɗe ngam soddugo kujeji
businesses, activities, and attractions closed
filluji, kuɗe, wakkereji ngilli maɓɓakke
businesses need local government permission to re-open
filluji yiɗi jarfuye ngomna ngam maɓɓitugo
restaurants (if they are even open) require a minimum distance between customers
cuuɗi nyamɗe (to ɗon maɓɓiti ma) sey soddooɓe daaya oya be oya
selling substandard face masks has a maximum sentence of life imprisonment
sippugo maskji je wonday kanduɗum footi yara dangay ha maya ha ton
As of mid-March 2020, Europe is the epicenter of the epidemic, and many European countries have closed their borders to international travel - only border commuters and freight are allowed to cross.
Ha cakkare Maars 2020, Erop woni ɓundu nyau ndu, be lesɗe Erop ɗuɗɗum maɓɓi keerolji maɓɓe ngam jaahangal diga lesdi feere, sna huwooɓe je wala keerol be pireewol feerejo footi salla.
Also businesses other than food stores and pharmacies are closed, and public transport has been reduced or stopped.
Filluji je wonday cuuɗi nyamɗe be je sippol lekki maɓɓakke, hortol ummatore ustakke mala darnakke.
In the worst affected countries including Italy, Spain and France, lockdowns like in China in January, have been implemented.
Ha lesɗe je nyau ndu tulli memmugo bana Italy, Spain be Faraansa, wondugo saare bana je Cayna ha Zaanviye ndu, ɗon wondi jonta.
As well the EU has closed its outer borders.
EU bo'o maɓɓi keereolji maɗa je yaasi.
COVID-19 is prevalent also in North America.
COVID-19 woni bo'o ha Woila America.

The borders between Canada, the U.S., and Mexico are closed to non-essential travel, and in many areas bans on big gatherings are in effect (this means places like restaurants are closed, and events are canceled).

Keereolji ha kunde Kanada, Lee America, be Mexico maɓɓakka ha jaahangalji je wonay kanduɗum, e ha nder wakkereji ɗuɗɗum haɗɗol do moftudeji jur ɗon wondi (bana wi'ugo wakkereji bana cuuɗi nyamɗe maɓɓakke, be kuɗe maɓɓakke).
Numerous state, county, and municipal jurisdictions have issued stay-at-home orders that require all nonessential businesses to close.
Lesɗe, lamorde, be wakkereji jur wurtini tawretaji do wondugo ha saare je yiɗi filluji je wonday kanduɗum maɓɓakke.
With lots of flights canceled, warnings issued, and restrictions imposed, flying in the time of coronavirus can be a challenge.
Be fiirolji jur willakke, hakkiloji je wurti, darnolji je ɗon hasdi, jaahangal ha wakati koronaviriis footi lata saɗirma.
Some routes are not possible.
Laabi feere ma footay waɗa.
Others will require more inconvenient connections than usual—multiple stops and long waits between flights.
Feere maran haaje jokkitolji je hannay do ko ɗon no salla tum, darnolji ɗum be ndeenolji jur ha kunde pireewolji.
In some cases that means more expensive tickets.
Ha wakkere feere yiɗi wi'ugo ceede jaahangal ɗon saɗɗi masitin.
On the other hand, the good news is that many flights are cheaper than usual due to decreased demand, and there's a decent chance you'll get an empty seat next to you.
Ha wakkere feere, kubar mbelka lati fiirolji ɗuɗɗum saɗɗay do je tumtum ngam emmolji usti, e wodi sa'a maungel je a footi keeɓa koorowal je wala goɗɗo ha seera maɗa.
Build in extra time for your connections, especially if transferring from an international flight to a domestic flight and especially if your itinerary involves a country that's seriously affected.
Waɗa jokkitolji maɗa ɓesda wakkati, ɓurna to wurtugo pireewol lesdi feere ngam nastugo pireewol lesdi e ɓurna to jaahangal maɗa larni lesdi je ɗon memmi be gonga.
Screenings, temperature checks, extra paperwork, and the associated waiting around can add minutes or hours before you're allowed to continue on your journey.
Lartolji, aynolji wullol ɓaandu, batakkaji feere, be ndeenolji footi ɓesda mintiji mala njamɗe hiddeko a mara jarfuye tokkitinugo jaahangal maɗa.
You may find it harder than usual to buy a ticket to or from a destination subject to warnings and restrictions.
Footi saɗɗa a heɓɓa soddugo ɗerewol jaahangal wurtugo mala nastugo wakkere je wodi hakkilolji be darnolji jur.
This is a real concern if you're trying to get out of an affected area.
Ndu lati larula manga to a yiɗi wurtugo wakkere je ɗon memmi.
For instance, most aggregators are not selling tickets from China to the United States (presumably to avoid falling afoul of restrictions and being on the hook for a passenger's flight out).
Bana sappinol, ɗowirɗeji jur sippata ɗerewol jaahangal ummugo Cayna ngam yahugo Lesdi America (ngam sallugo do'ugo do haɗɗolji mala ngam ndeenugo pireewol sallooɓe ha yaasi).
To buy a ticket for an itinerary like this, you may have to contact the airline or use a lesser-known aggregator.
Soddugo ɗerewol jaahangal bana ndu, footi sey a ewna ɗowirɗe pireewol ndu mala huwida be ɗowirɗe je aandakke jur.

Another possibility is to buy two separate tickets (for instance, a ticket from China to Cambodia and a second ticket from Cambodia to the U.S.), but be careful you won't get quarantined or lose your luggage in between.

Dabare feere bo'o lati soddugo ɗereji jaahangal feere-feere ɗiɗi (bana sappinol, ɗerewol wurtol Cayna ha Cambodiya e ɗiɗaɓool man bo'o diga Cambodiya ha Lesɗe America), amma hakkilu ngam ta ɓe sigga ma ha seera mala majjina kujeji maɗa.
Connecting flights can be a problem.
Jokkitugo pireewolji footi wona larula.
The risk of getting stuck in the connection city is higher than usual right now, due to delays for screening and testing as well as extensive cancellations.
Sababu ɗaaggugo ha nder berniwol jokkittol ɓuri do ko wowi jonta, ngam ɗaayolji aynol be lartol be darnolji je ɗon waagare.
Connecting in an affected area may lead to entry restrictions later on, and if you've been in an affected area recently some countries won't even let you change planes.

Jokkitugo ha nder wakkere je ɗon mari nyau footi yotta ha darnolji nastirde ha yakke feere, e to woni no ha nder wakkere je ɗon mari nyau neeɓay ha nder lesɗe feere footay hokka ma jarfuye saanjugo pireewolji.
On certain itineraries there is a risk of getting quarantined somewhere along the way.
Ha do jaahangalji feere wodi sababu wondugo ha seera ha wakkere feere do lawol.
So book a direct flight if you can, and if not, think carefully about where to connect.
Nden kadi soddu ɗerewol pireewol je yahatta ciir, e to waɗatakke, nummu boɗɗum don toy footi a jokkita.
In uncertain times, plans can change.
Ha wakati je aandakke, jaahargalji footi saanja.
Many embassies and consulates have evacuated nonessential staff, and some have shut down operations completely.
Fadoɓe lesdi mala ngomna lesdi ha do lesdi feere jur wartiri huwooɓe je maray kugal jur, e ɓe'en feere darni kugal man gabbaa.
Emergency assistance should still be available, though it's possible you may have to contact a further-away consulate if your local one has shut down.
Wallende jaawal sey wonda, ko to footi a ngamna lesdi maɗa je ɗon ha lesdi feere ko to je wakkere maɗa don maɓɓi.
If you have been stranded due to the pandemic, your nearest consulate may be able to help you find a flight home, arrange an emergency loan so you can buy a ticket, or provide an emergency passport.

To a ɗon no joɗɗi ngam nyau duniyaru ndu, ngomna lesdi maɗa ha lesdi feere je ɗon ɓadi footi walla ma nder heɓɓugo pireewol wartugo saare, taska ceede jaawal ngam heɓɓa a sodda ɗerewol jaahangal, mala wurtina passport jaawal.
At the very least they can keep you informed about the local situation and notify you about recently introduced travel requirements and restrictions.
Pettum man bo'o, footi ɓe hokka ma matinol do ko ɗon salla jonta ha nder wakkere e matina mon do dabareji be darnolji jaahangal je ɓe wurtini.
Ordinary consular services such as visa and passport processing may be suspended or restricted to urgent need, depending on the location and the consulate.
Kuɗe ngomna lesdi ha lesdi feere je tumtum bana laahal wurtinugo visa be passport footi darnotto mala ustotto ha haaje jaawal, do wakkere be ngomna lesdi man.
Although some people call the disease "Wuhan pneumonia" (武汉(漢)肺炎/武肺), "Wuhan disease", or "Chinese virus", the use of these terms is considered racist in China and by many people of Chinese origin.
Ko to yimɓe feere ɗon ewna nyau man "Wuhan pneumonia" (武汉(漢)肺炎/武肺), "Nyau Wuhan", mala "viriis Cayna", ewnugo bana ni lati bana lasɓinol asngol ha Cayna be ha gite je jippi ha asli Cayna.
It is still common to refer the disease as "Wuhan pneumonia" or "Chinese virus" in places like Hong Kong and Taiwan.
Lati kooyɗum ewnugo nyau man bana "Wuhan pneumonia" mala "viriis Cayna" ha wakkereji bana Hong Kong be Taiwan.
To be safe, use location-neutral terms when referring to the disease, such as "COVID-19", "novel coronavirus", or just "the virus" or "the pandemic".
Ngam wondugo jam, ngewte be wolde je umminata hakkilo to bana yiɗi wolwugo do nyau, bana "COVID-19", "Koronaviriis keese" mala bo'o "viriis" mala "nyau duniyaru".

Particularly in developing countries where law enforcement are poorly trained, enforcement of curfew, lockdown or stay-at-home orders are often brutal, often using forces not proportionate against crowds.

Ha lesɗe je ɗon laffi masin ɓurna fu je yimɓe ngomna ɗon ayna wala aandal boɗɗe, ɗowitinugo tawreta je wala wurtugo, wonde mala wala wurtugo saare ɗon lati bana haɓre, e ɗon waɗa sembe je hannay do ummatore ha yakke feere.
Comply with these orders, and avoid crowds in public.
Heeɗite tawretaji ndu, e lutte mofturde ummatore.
As a result of the coronavirus pandemic, xenophobia has risen in many countries, primarily but not exclusively targeting people perceived to be Chinese.
Bana sappinol nyau koronaviriis, gaanyo be hoɗɓe ummi ha lesɗe jur, aranool amma na kanjum tan ɗon larni yimɓe je ɗon naandi yimɓe Cayna.
There has been a worldwide spike in racist incidents targeting people of East Asian origin, including in major cities such as New York, London and San Francisco.
Wodi larulaji ngam asgnol jur je ummiki ha nder duniyaru do yimɓe je ummi gal Funaange Asia, ha ɓurna berniji bana New York, London be San Francisco.

In Hong Kong, Sinophobia, which was already high to begin with, has intensified as a result of the pandemic, with the result that many shops and restaurants are now denying service to mainland Chinese customers and banning Mandarin speakers from their premises (with the exception of Taiwanese).

Ha Hong Kong, Sinophobia, je ɗon no woni jur timmi, ɓesdi be wangirde nyau duniyaru ndu, be sappinolji je cuuɗi fillu be cuuɗi nyamɗe suklata do yimɓe lesdi Cayna e ɗon farta ngewtooɓe wolde Mandarin (sna yimɓe Taiwan tan).
Levels of xenophobia have also risen in East Asia, with some restaurants and other businesses in Japan and China refusing service to foreign customers.
Yahde gaanyol hoɗɓe ɓesdi bo'o ha Funaange Asia, be cuuɗi nyamɗe be filluji feere ha Japan be Cayna je ɗon salla suklugo do soddooɓe lesdi feere.

In China, there have been incidents of foreigners being refused rooms by hotel staff, and foreign residents, particularly black people, being kicked out of their apartments on short notice by their landlords.
Ha Cayna, wodi larulaji do hoɗɓe je ɓe sallini ɓe suudu gal huwooɓe hotelji, yimɓe je ummi lesdɗe feere, ɓurna fu ɓaaleɓe, je ɓe wurtini ɓe be sembe ha nder saare maɓɓe do hasduye marɗo saare.
Sources for further information on the coronavirus outbreak include:
Matinolji feere do nyau koronaviriis larni:
The US government Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Ɗowirɗeji Aynol be Lartol Nyau Lesɗe America
European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (daily updates)
Ɗowirɗeji Aynol be Lartol Nyau Lesɗe Erop (matinolji lartama tum)
United Kingdom government, - Foreign and Commonwealth Office advice for Travellers
Ngomna Lesɗe Inglisiya, - Foreign and Commonwealth Office advice for Travellers
An online map and dashboard from the John Hopkins University Center for Systems Science and Engineering with live updates
Karte be sappinol je ɗon woni do internati gal John Hopkins University Center for Systems Science and Engineering ɓe matinolji lartotto do gite mon
Partial lists of entry restrictions from IATA and The New York Times
Batakkewol darnolji nastirde IATA beThe New York Times
A variety of misinformation and conspiracy theories about the virus are being promoted online and even by some government officials, so be careful which sources you check for information.
Wodi ngewteji do matinolji be tufle kalluɗum do viriis ɗon salla do internati be feere ma gal yimɓe ngomna, nden kadi sey on hakkila be moy hokki mon matinolji ndu.
Ensure that all information and advice you receive has been backed by reputable doctors and scientists.
Famme bo'o to matinolji be feeloji fu je on keeɓi feelama gal lekkitoɓe be teffoɓe je ɗon aandi mari aandal .

In a crisis, it's natural to want to keep following the latest updates, but it may be better for your mental health to moderate the amount of news that you look at, and stick to reliable news sources.
Ha nder larula, lati kanduɗum teffugo fammugo matinolji keese, amma wonan bo'o kanduɗum ha jam hakkilo moɗon larta matinolji je naffata on, o teffe matinolji je wurti gal hunduko je ɗon mari amana.
If you normally watch the news twice per day then stick to this schedule and do something else, rather than having the 24-hour news on continuously.
To a ɗon no lara matinolji nde ɗiɗi ha nder balɗe, nden kadi joɗɗidu do jaahargal ndu e suklu do waɗɗugo kuje feere, do tokkitugo larugo matinolji ha nder njamɗe 24.
b'Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) is an enzyme attached to the outer surface (cell membranes) of cells in the lungs, arteries, heart, kidney, and intestines.
b'Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) lati neeɓam je ɗon wondi gal yaasi daaldal (laaral cellji) cellji ha nder fuffu, laabi iyam, ɓernde, ɓooye, be teetekki.

ACE2 counters the activity of the related angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) by reducing the amount of angiotensin-II and increasing Ang(1-7) making it a promising drug target for treating cardiovascular diseases.ACE2 also serves as the entry point into cells for some coronaviruses.

ACE2 ɗon haɗɗa kugal ko larni neebam waylittol angiotensin (ACE) gal ustugo yahde angiotensin-II be ɓesdugo Ang(1-7) je ɗon wartira ɗum bana lekki je footi naffa nder hurgol nyauji ɓernde. ACE2 bo'o lati bana dammugal ha nder cellji ha koronaviriisji feere.
The human version of the enzyme is often referred to as hACE2.
Neebam je neɗɗo ɓurna fu ewnotto bana hACE2.
Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 is a zinc containing metalloenzyme located on the surface of endothelial and other cells.
Neebam 2 je ɗon waylitta Angiotensin lati metalloenzyme je ɗon mari zinc e ɗon woni ha do endothelial be cellji feere.
ACE2 protein contains an N-terminal peptidase M2 domain and a C-terminal collectrin renal amino acid transporter domain.
ACE2 protein ɗon mari N-terminal peptidase M2 domain be C-terminal collectrin renal amino acid transporter domain.
ACE2 is a single-pass type I membrane protein, with its enzymatically active domain exposed on the surface of cells in lungs and other tissues.
ACE2 is lati nastirde woore type I membrane protein, je ɗon mari neebam je ɗon huwa e ɗon woni do cellji ha nder fuffu be kujeji feere.

The extracellular domain of ACE2 is cleaved from the transmembrane domain by another enzyme known as sheddase, and the resulting soluble protein is released into the blood stream and ultimately excreted into urine.
Domain ACE2 je gal yaasi cell ɗon ta'i be transmembrane domain gal neebam feere je mbiyotto bana sheddase, be proteinji je ɗon ɗiggi ɗon illa nder iyam e ha ragare man wurtan gal ciile.

ACE2 is present in most organs: ACE2 is attached to the cell membrane of mainly lung type II alveolar cells, enterocytes of the small intestine, arterial and venous endothelial cells and arterial smooth muscle cells in most organs.

ACE2 ɗon wondi ha ɓurna kujeji ɗaandu: ACE2 ɗon hawti be laaral cell je fuffu je ɓurna cellji type II alveolar, enterocytes teetekki je peetel, ceelji arterial be venous endothelial be cellji arterial smooth muscle ha ɓurna kujeji ɓaandu.
ACE2 mRNA expression is also found in the cerebral cortex, striatum, hypothalamus, and brainstem.
Jaangirde ACE2 mRNA tawama bo'o ha nder cerebral cortex, striatum, hypothalamus, be ɗaaɗon ngaandi.
The primary function of ACE2 is to act as a counter balance to ACE.
Aranool kugal ACE2 lati bana counter balance ha ACE.
ACE cleaves angiotensin I hormone into the vasoconstricting angiotensin II.
ACE ɗon wartira hormone angiotensin I do vasoconstricting angiotensin II.

ACE2 in turn cleaves the carboxyl-terminal amino acid phenylalanine from angiotensin II (Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-Phe) and hydrolyses it into the vasodilator angiotensin (1-7), (H-Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-OH).
ACE2 kanjuum bo'o ɗon wartira carboxyl-terminal amino acid phenylalanine diga angiotensin II (Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-Phe) do vasodilator angiotensin (1-7), (H-Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-OH).
ACE2 can also cleave a number of other peptides including [des-Arg9]-bradykinin, apelin, neurotensin, dynorphin A, and ghrelin.
ACE2 footi bo'o wartira lamba peptidji feere bana [des-Arg9]-bradykinin, apelin, neurotensin, dynorphin A, be ghrelin.
ACE2 also regulates the membrane trafficking of the neutral amino acid transporter SLC6A19 and has been implicated in Hartnup's disease.
ACE2 bo'o ɗon mo'ina laaral roondoowo neutral amino acid SLC6A19 e lati bana ɗaaɗol nyau Hartnup.

As a transmembrane protein, ACE2 serves as the main entry point into cells for some coronaviruses, including HCoV-NL63; SARS-CoV (the virus that causes SARS); and SARS-CoV-2 (the virus that causes COVID-19).
Bana transmembrane protein, ACE2 lati bana dammugal woore ha nder cellji koronaviriisji feere, bana HCoV-NL63; SARS-CoV (the virus that causes SARS); and SARS-CoV-2 (viriis je wangini COVID-19).

More specifically, the binding of the spike S1 protein of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV2 to the enzymatic domain of ACE2 on the surface of cells results in endocytosis and translocation of both the virus and the enzyme into endosomes located within cells.

Laɓɓinugo bo'o, hawtirde spike S1 protein je SARS-CoV be SARS-CoV2 ha enzymatic domain ACE2 do cellji latan endocytosis be translocation viriisji ɗiɗi ndu be neebam do endosomeji je ɗon wondi ha nder cellji.

This entry process also requires priming of the S protein by the host serine protease TMPRSS2, the inhibition of which is under current investigation as a potential therapeutic.This has led some to hypothesize that decreasing the levels of ACE2, in cells, might help in fighting the infection.

Nastirde ndu yardi fuɗɗorde S protein gal jaɓɓowo serine protease TMPRSS2, je illam man ɗon do teffol bana dabare hurgol. Ndu waɗi en tammi yo'o ustol yahdeji ACE2, ha nder cellji, footi naffa ngam hurgol nyau ndu.
However, multiple professional societies and regulatory bodies have recommended continuing standard ACE inhibitor and ARB therapy.
However, multiple professional societies and regulatory bodies have recommended continuing standard ACE inhibitor and ARB therapy.
A systematic review and meta-analysis published on July 11, 2012, found that "use of ACE inhibitors was associated with a significant 34% reduction in risk of pneumonia compared with controls."
Lartol fu be laritolji ekkitolji fu je wangi ha 11 Zwiiye 2012, tawi yo'o "huwugo be of ACE inhibitors hawti no be ustol 34% sababu pneumonia foondi be aynolji."
Moreover, "the risk of pneumonia was also reduced in patients treated with ACE inhibitors who were at higher risk of pneumonia, in particular those with stroke and heart failure.
Fahin bo'o, "sababu pneumonia usti ha nyauɓe je hurgotto be ACE inhibitors je ɗon no mari sababu maungel raɓɓugo pneumonia, ɓurna fu ha ɓe'en je ɗon mari nyau illol iyam be semɓe be nyau ɓernde.
Use of ACE inhibitors was also associated with a reduction in pneumonia related mortality, although the results were less robust than for overall risk of pneumonia."
Hoosugo ACE inhibitors hawti bo'o be ustol mayde gal pneumonia, ko to sappinolji lessi do sababu pneumonia fu".

Recombinant human ACE2 (rhACE2) is surmised to be a novel therapy for acute lung injury, and appeared to improve pulmonary hemodynamics and oxygen saturation in piglets with a lipopolysaccharide-induced acute respiratory distress syndrome.

Recombinant human ACE2 (rhACE2) woni bana hurgol keese ngam huudure do fuffu je nyaɗay, e bana ɗon hokka sembe ha iyam nder fuffu be hebbinol hendu ha ɓikkon gaduji je ɓe tuffini ɓe gilɗi nyau pofɗe je larni lipopolysaccharide.
The half-life of rhACE2 in human beings is about 10 hours and the onset of action is 30 minutes in addition to the course of effect (duration) of 24 hours.
Reeta yonki rhACE2 ha neɗɗo woni gal njamɗe 10 e fuɗɗam kugal lati minti 30 be ɓedugo ha yahde sababu (wakati) ha nder njamɗe 24.

Several findings suggest that rhACE2 may be a promising drug for those with intolerance to classic renin-angiotensin system inhibitors (RAS inhibitors) or in diseases where circulating angiotensin II is elevated.Infused rhACE2 has been evaluated in clinical trials for the treatment of acute respiratory distress syndrome.

Sappinolji jur ɗon feela yo'o rhACE2 footi wona lekki kanduɗum ha yimɓe je footay jaɓɓa classic renin-angiotensin system inhibitors (RAS inhibitors) mala ha nyauji je angiotensin II ɗon wa'i. rhACE2 je ɓe tuffi lartama ha nder lartolji suudu lekki ngam hurgol nyau saɗirma nder pofɗe.

b'Bat SARS-like coronavirus WIV1 (Bat SL-CoV-WIV1), also sometimes called SARS-like coronavirus WIV1, is a strain of Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus (SARSr-CoV) isolated from Chinese rufous horseshoe bats (Rhinolophus sinicus).

Koronaviriis je naandi SARS b'Bat WIV1 (Bat SL-CoV-WIV1), je ɓe ɗon ewna ha yakke feere koronaviriis je naandi SARS WIV1, woni asngol koronaviriis (SARSr-CoV) je ɗon hokka nyau pofɗe je nyaɗum je tawama ha nder bilwili je naandi paɗɗe puccu (Rhinolophus sinicus) Cayna.
Like all coronaviruses, virions consist of single-stranded positive-sense RNA enclosed within an envelope.
Bana naandi koronaviriisji fu, ɓiɓe viriisji mari kosngal RNA woore tan je ɗon suudi ha nder suudu feere.
The discovery confirms that bats are the natural reservoir of SARS-CoV.
Tawol ɗon sappina yo'o bilwili on woni ɓundu SARS-CoV.
Phylogenetic analysis shows the possibility of direct transmission of SARS from bats to humans without the intermediary Chinese civets, as previously believed.
Lartol asngol gene ɗon sappina dabare sallinol SARS diga bilwili ha goɗɗo bila sallugo gal patuuji Cayna bana cakkare suudu, bana ɗon tammi ha aran.

b'COVID-19 apps are mobile software applications designed to aid contact tracing in response to the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, i.e. the process of identifying persons ("contacts") who may have been in contact with an infected individual.

b'COVID-19 apps woni applicasionji je ɓe wurtini ngam wallugo teffugo yimɓe bana jabbuye do nyau koronaviriis 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, bana wi'ugo laahal maandugo yimɓe ("ngidooɓe") je footi wondi no be goɗɗo je ɗon mari nyau.
Numerous applications were developed or proposed, with official government support in some territories and jurisdictions.
Applikasionji jur wangi mala ɗon feeli, be wallende ngomna be hoore mako ha nder wakkareji be lamordeji feere.
Several frameworks for building contact tracing apps have been developed.
Sappinolji dabare wanginugo applikasionji tawtol wurtama.
Privacy concerns have been raised, especially about systems that are based on tracking the geographical location of app users.
Larulaji ngam amana wangi no'o, ɓurna fu do dabareji je ɗon wondi do tawtugo wakkere jonde yimɓe je ɗon huwa be applikasionji ndu.
Less intrusive alternatives include the use of Bluetooth signals to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
Dabareji je lessi sappinugo matinolji do goɗɗo ɗon huwa be mandolji Bluetooth ngam hoosugo ɓadol be telefonji feere.
On 10 April 2020, Google and Apple jointly announced that they would integrate functionality to support such Bluetooth-based apps directly into their Android and iOS operating systems.
Ha 10 Aviiril 2020, Google be Apple matini ha wakati gootel yo'o ɓe nastinan kujeji ngam mballugo irin applikasionji be Bluetooth ha nder dabareji kugal Android be iOS maɓɓe.
In China, the Chinese government, in conjunction with Alipay, has deployed an app that allows citizens to check if they have been in contact with people that have COVID-19.
Ha Cayna, ngomna Cayna, hawti be Alipay, wurtini applikasion feere je ɗon hokka jarfuye ha ummatore larta to ɓe ngondi no be yimɓe je mari no COVID-19.
It is in use across more than 200 Chinese cities.In Singapore, an app called TraceTogether is being used.
Yimɓe ɗon huwa be man ha nder berniji Cayna 200. Ha Singapore, wodi applikasion je ewnotto TraceTogether.

The app was developed by local IT community, released as open source and will be handed over to the government.North Macedonia launched "StopKorona!", a Bluetooth-based app to trace exposure with potentially infected persons and provide a fast response to healthcare authorities.

Yimɓe IT ummatore on wurtini applikasion man, wangi bana maɓɓiti ha ko moy fu e hokkan ndu ha ngomna. Ha Woila Macedoniya wodi applikasion feere je ɗon huwa be Bluetoth je ewnotto "StopKorona!", ngam sappinugo sababuji je temma on wondi be yimɓe je ɗon mari nyau e hokka jabbuye law ha arduɓe jam ɓaandu.
The app was developed by the Ministry of Communication and Technology and Ministry of Health.
Applikasion wangi gal kugal Geeɓeji Ngewte be Teknik be Jam Ɓaandu.
As of 14 April 2020, the app was awaiting approval by the Google Play Store and Apple App Store.
Ha 14 Aviiril 2020, applikasion ndu ɗon no ndeena jaɓɓol Google Play Store be Apple App Store.

On 12 April, the government stated that the contact tracing app was in an advanced stage of development, and would be available for deployment within weeks.A similar app is planned in Ireland, and in France ("StopCovid").

Ha 12 Aviiril, ngomna matini yo'o applikasion tawtugo yimɓe ha nder yahde je ɗon nyauɗum, e wondan ngam sendugo ha nder asaweji. Jaahargal irin applikasion ndu ngaɗi timmi ha Ireland, be Faraansa ("StopCovid").

Both Australia and New Zealand are considering apps based on Singapore's TraceTogether app and BlueTrace protocol.Russia intends to introduce a geofencing app for patients diagnosed with COVID-19 living in Moscow, designed to ensure they do not leave home.

Australia be New Zealand ɗon larta applikasionji je ɗon wondi do aandal applikasion TraceTogether Singapore be dabare BlueTrace. Russiya tammi wanginugo applikasion waɗugo keleewol wakkerereji ngam nyauɓe COVID-19 je wondi ha Moscow, ngam fammugo be fakatre ɓe wala wurtugo saare.

Ross Anderson, professor of security engineering at Cambridge University, listed a number of potential practical problems with app-based systems, including false positives and the potential lack of effectiveness if takeup of the app is limited to only a small fraction of the population.

Ross Anderson, jaanginowo security engineering ha Cambridge University, limti no larulaji je kugal je applikasionji footi mara, bana sappinugo goɗɗo bana mari nyau amma wonay gonga, e fottay wonda kanduɗum to ɗon larni ummatore seeɗa tan.

Addressing concerns about the spread of misleading or harmful "coronavirus" apps, Apple set limits on which types of organizations could add coronavirus-related apps to its App Store, limiting them to only "official" or otherwise reputable organizations.

Be lintugo larulaji ngam wangolji waagare applikasionji "koronaviriis" je wonay gonga mala kalluɗum, Apple sappini keerolji je geeɓeji footi ɓesda applikasionji je larni koronaviriis ha App Store maɗa, haɗɗugo ndu ha "ngomna" mala geeɓeji je ɗon aandi.
Google and Amazon have implemented similar restrictions.
Google be Amazon waɗi irin keleewolji ndu timmi.

Privacy campaigners voiced their concern regarding the implications of mass surveillance using coronavirus apps, in particular about whether surveillance infrastructure created to deal with the coronavirus pandemic will be dismantled once the threat has passed.

Yimɓe je ɗon no sikka ngam larula je larni amana holli larula maɓɓe do ko larni aynol yimɓe fu gal applikasionji koronaviriis, ɓurna fu do to dabare aynol je ɓe wangini ngam darnugo nyau koronaviriis darnotto to nyau man salli.
Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issued a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.
Amnesty International be ɓuri geeɓeji 100 feere wurtini haala feere gal ewnugo do keleewolji do irin aynolji ndu.
The organisations declared eight conditions on governmental projects:
Geeɓeji ndu matini larulaji do kuɗe ngomna:
surveillance would have to be "lawful, necessary and proportionate";
aynol footi wona no "kanduɗum, mari naffuda be kalkal";
extensions of monitoring and surveillance would have to have sunset clauses;
juttinol llartol be aynol maran no umroji do darnol;
the use of data would have to be limited to COVID-19 purposes;
kugal be matinolji haɗɗan no do dabareji ngam COVID-19.
data security and anonymity would have to be protected and shown to be protected based on evidence;
jam matinolji be bila windol inde wonan no siggotto e wona bana ɗon fadi do sappinolji;
digital surveillance would have to avoid exacerbating discrimination and marginalisation;
aynol matinolji darnan no lasɓinol be gaanyu je ɗon ɓesda ndu;
any sharing of data with third parties would have to be defined in law;
kala sendol matinolji be goɗɗo feere sey umrore hasda do ndu;
there would have to be safeguards against abuse and the rights of citizens to respond to abuses;
dabareji keerolji wonan ngam huddi be jarfuji ummatore ngam jabbinugo do huddi;

meaningful participation by all "relevant stakeholders" would be required, including that of public health experts and marginalised groups.The German Chaos Computer Club (CCC) and Reporters Without Borders (Reporter ohne Grenzen) (RSF) also issued checklists.

wondugo yimɓe fu nder dabare ndu gal "jagorɓe kanduɗum" sey emmotto, bana je wawooɓe jam ɓaandu be geeɓe je lasbinama. German Chaos Computer Club (CCC) be Reporters Without Borders (Reporter ohne Grenzen) (RSF) wurtini bo'o dabareji.
The proposed Google/Apple plan intends to address the problem of persistent surveillance by removing the tracing mechanism from their device operating systems once it is no longer needed.
Jaahargal Google/Apple yiɗi larugo nder haala aynol je ɗon tokkiti ndu gal ittugo dabare sappinol wakkere je goɗɗo ɗon wondi ha ton nder ordoji maɓɓe ha ɓawo to wala naffuda fahin.
Some countries used network-based location tracking instead of apps, eliminating both the need to download an app and the ability to avoid tracking.
Lesɗe feere ɗon no huwida be ordo aynol amma na be applikasionji, ko ɗon waɗa bila wattugo applikasion feere be dabare je wala goɗɗo tokka ma gal ɓawo.
In Israel, network-based tracking was approved.
Ha Israayila, dabare aynol be ordo jaɓɓama.
Network-based solutions that have access to raw location data have significant potential privacy problems.
Dabareji je wondi gal aynol wakkere wonde ɗon footi mara larulaji be matinolji amana yimɓe.

However, not all systems with central servers need to have access to personal location data; a number of privacy-preserving systems have been created that use central servers only for intercommunication (see section below).

Amma, na kala dabareji fu be ordoji cakkare mari haaje nastugo nder matinolji do wonde moɗon; wodi dabareji siggorde matinolji ngurtama je ɗon salla gal ordoji cakkare ngam saanjol ngewte (lare geeɓe je les).
In South Korea, a non-app-based system was used to perform contact tracing.
Ha South Korea, wodi dabare je wonday do applikasion naffi ngam lartugo ngidol.

Instead of using a dedicated app, the system gathered tracking information from a variety of sources including mobile device tracking data and card transaction data, and combined these to generate notices via text messages to potentially-infected individuals.

Ha do huwugo be applikasion je ɗon hokki, ordo ndu mofti matinoljin laritol ndu gal dabare feere-feere bana matinolji wonde telefon be matinolji karte ceede, e hawti ɓe fu ngam wurtinugo batakkeji gal bindi ha yimɓe je footi mara nyau.

In addition to using this information to alert potential contacts, the government has also made the location information publicly available, something permitted because of far-reaching changes to information privacy laws after the MERS outbreak in that country.

Ha ɓesdugo huwugo be matinolji sappinugo baabal wonde , ngomna wurtini matinolji wondugo maɓɓittama ha ummatore fu, ko ɗon jarfi ngam saanjolji feere be umroji do matinolji ha ɓawo nyau MERS ha lesdi ndu.
This information is available to the public via a number of apps and websites.Countries including Germany considered using both centralized and privacy-preserving systems.
Matinolji ndu ɗon maɓɓitti ha ummatore gal limgal applikasionji be wedji. Lesɗe bana Jaamani hasdi ngam hawtugo dabareji joggugo matinolji be je cakkare.
As of 6 April 2020, the details had not yet been released.
Ha 6 Aviiril 2020, matinolji man ngurtay no tawon.

Privacy-preserving contact tracing is a well-established concept, with a substantial body of research literature dating back to at least 2013.As of 7 April 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.

Laritol wakkere wonde be matinolji je siggotto ɗon aandi, be ekkitoji teffooɓe je ɗon lora pettum man 2013. Ha 7 Aviiril 2020, ɓuri wawooɓe sappo e ɗiɗi huwidi no do dabareji siggorde matiolji, bana huwugo be Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) ngam teffugo huwoowo be telefonji feere.

However, PEPP-PT is a co-ordination effort which contains both centralised and decentralised approaches, and is not a single protocol.Decentralised protocols include Decentralized Privacy-Preserving Proximity Tracing (DP-PPT/DP-3T), Temporary Contact Numbers (TCN, fka Contact Event Numbers, CEN), Privacy Sensitive Protocols and Mechanisms for Mobile Contact Tracing (PACT) and others.

Amma, PEPP-PT woni sembe je hawtama je wodi dabareji ɗiɗi fu je cakkare be je sankittito, e wonay dabare woore. Dabareji je ɗon sankittito larni Decentralized Privacy-Preserving Proximity Tracing (DP-PPT/DP-3T), Temporary Contact Numbers (TCN, fka Contact Event Numbers, CEN), Privacy Sensitive Protocols and Mechanisms for Mobile Contact Tracing (PACT) be feere.
In these protocols, identifiable personal data never leaves the device, and all matching happens on-device.
Ha nder dabareji ndu, matinolji je footi heɓta footay wurta ordo, e hawtirde fu don salla do ordo ndu.

The Privacy Group at MIT Media Lab has been developing SafePaths, a platform for using privacy-preserving techniques when collecting and using location or path intersection data to track the spread of COVID-19.

Privacy Group ha MIT Media Lab ɗon no haɗda do SafePaths, daaldal huwugo be dabareji siggorde maandirɗum ha wakati mofturde matinolji be huwugo be matinolji wakkere be ngidol ngam aynugo sankittol COVID-19.

It is based on research from the whitepaper "Apps Gone Rogue: Maintaining Personal Privacy in an Epidemic" released in March 2020.Another similar effort is the SafeTrace platform by Enigma MPC, a company developing privacy technologies that was also originally founded at the MIT Media Lab.

Wondi do teffol deftere je wala kuje ha ton "Apps Gone Rogue: Maintaining Personal Privacy in an Epidemic" je wurti ha Maars 2020. Wodi irin dabare ndu je woni daaldal SafeTrace gal Enigma MPC, geeɓe feere je ɗon huwa do wurtinugo dabareji aandol je tawama bo'o ha MIT Media Lab.
SafeTrace utilizes secure hardware technologies to allow users to share sensitive location and health data with other users and officials, without compromising the privacy of that data.
SafeTrace ɗon huwa be dabareji teknik je jam jarfugo huwooɓe senda matinolji do wakkere be jam ɓaandu be yimɓe feere be ymɓe ngomna, bila hallinugo matinolji maandirɗum

On 5 April 2020, the global TCN Coalition was founded by groups that had coalesced around what was essentially the same approach and largely overlapping protocols, with the goal to reduce fragmentation, and enable global interoperability of tracing and alerting apps, a key aspect of achieving widespread adoption.

Ha 5 Aviiril 2020, TCN Coalition fu wangi gal geeɓeji je hawti ha ɓawo ko lati bana mari irin dabare man be irin yaɓɓordeji ndu, je hasdi ngam ustugo ta'irdeji, e waɗa yo'o aynol sankittol nyau ndu salla gal applikasionji je footi ha keerolji duniyaru fu.
On 9 April 2020, the Singaporean government announced that it had open-sourced the BlueTrace protocol used by its official government app.
Ha 9 Aviiril 2020, ngomna Singapore matini yo'o o wangini dabare BlueTrace ha yeeso ummatore fu gal applikasion je hokki ha ngomna maɗa.

On 10 April 2020, Google and Apple, the companies that control the Android and iOS mobile platforms, announced an initiative for contact tracing, which they claimed would preserve privacy, based on a combination of Bluetooth Low Energy technology and privacy-preserving cryptography.

Ha 10 Aviiril 2020, Google be Apple, geeɓeji mauɓe je ɗon mari daaldal telefon Android be iOS, matini dabare feere ngam laritol ngidol, je ɓe tammi siggan maadirɗum yimɓe, gal dabarehawtirde Bluetooth Low Energy technology be bindi je ɗon sigga matinolji maandirɗum.
They also published specifications of the core technologies used in the system.
Fahin bo'o ɓe wurtini cakkare dabareji je woni ha nder ordo ndu.
According to Apple and Google, the system is intended to be rolled out in three stages:
Ha limtol Apple be Google, ordo ndu wurtan nder yaɓɓordeji tati:
rollout of tools to enable governments to create official privacy-preserving coronavirus tracing apps
wurtinol kujeji ngam heɓɓa ngomna wangina applikasionji aynol sankittol koronaviriis je ngomna e je ɗon sigga mandirɗum.

integration of this functionality directly into iOS and AndroidGoogle and Apple plan to address the take-up and persistent surveillance problems by first distributing the system through operating system updates, and later removing it in the same way once the threat has passed.

nastinugo kuɗe maɗa ha nder jaahargal iOS be AndroidGoogle be Apple ngam heɓɓugo jabbuji ha do jaɓɓol be larulaji aynol gal sendugo ha aranool man tawon dabare mal gal lartollji huwugo ordoji ndu, e ha ɓawo man ittugo ndu bana ha fuɗɗam to nyau man salli timmi.
b'COVID-19 drug development is the research process to develop a preventative vaccine or therapeutic prescription drug that would alleviate the severity of 2019-20 coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
Wurtinol lekki b'COVID-19 lati laahal teffol ngam wurtinugo baatal je aynugo mala lekki je hurgatta je footi usta sembe nyau koronaviriis 2019-20 (COVID-19).

The International Clinical Trials Registry Platform of the WHO recorded 536 clinical studies to develop post-infection therapies for COVID-19 infections, with numerous established antiviral compounds for treating other infections under clinical research to be repurposed.

International Clinical Trials Registry Platform je WHO windi ekkitolji jam ɓaandu 536 ngam wurtinugo hurgolji nyau COVID-19 , be hawtirdeji je mabardugo viriis ngam hurgugo nyauji feere je ɗon do teffol sey larta ndu

In March, the WHO initiated the "SOLIDARITY Trial" in 10 countries, enrolling thousands of people infected with COVID-19 to assess treatment effects of four existing antiviral compounds with the most promise of efficacy.
Ha Maars, WHO fuɗɗi "SOLIDARITY Trial" ha nder lesɗe 10, be windugo yimɓe je mari nyau COVID-19 ngam lartugo sababuji hurgol,be hawtirdeji kujeji je mbardatta viriis nay be naffuda je ɓuri kanduɗum.

A dynamic, systematic review was established in April 2020 to track the progress of registered clinical trials for COVID-19 vaccine and therapeutic drug candidates.Vaccine and drug development is a multistep process, typically requiring more than five years to assure safety and efficacy of the new compound.

Lartol fu fuɗɗi ha Aviiril 2020 ngam lartugo yahde foondolji baatal be lekki hurgugo COVID-19. Wurtinugo baatal mala lekki ɗon mari yaɓɓordeji jur, ɓurna fu hoosan duɓɓi joowey ngam jam be naffuda hawtirdeji lekki man.
Drug development is the process of bringing a new infectious disease vaccine or therapeutic drug to the market once a lead compound has been identified through the process of drug discovery.
Wurtinugo lekki lati laahal wanginugo baatal mala lekki hurgugo nyau keese je ɗon raɓɓa yimɓe ha do lumo to wodi hawtirde lekki je aranool ɗon maandi gal laahal tawol.

It includes laboratory research on microorganisms and animals, filing for regulatory status, such as via the FDA, for an investigational new drug to initiate clinical trials on humans, and may include the step of obtaining regulatory approval with a new drug application to market the drug.

Larni teffol do gilɗiji be daabaji ha nder suudu lartol, emmugo fadol, bana gal FDA, ngam teffugo lekki keese lata foondotto ha suudu lekkita do neɗɗo, e footi mara yaɓɓorde heɓɓugo jaɓɓol fadol be wurtinugo lekki keese ha do lumo.
Development of a COVID-19 vaccine or therapeutic antiviral drug begins with matching a chemical concept to the potential prophylactic mechanism of the future vaccine or antiviral activity in vivo.
Wurtinol baatal mala lekki je mbardatta viriis COVID-19 ɗon fuɗɗa be tawugo lekki gooto be dabare prophylactic baatal ndu mala kuɗe mbardugo viriis je ɗon yeeɗa.
New chemical entities (NCEs, also known as new molecular entities or NMEs) are compounds that emerge from the process of drug discovery to specify a vaccine or antiviral candidate.
Kuujeji feere keese (NCE, je mbiyotto bo'o kujeji molecular keese mala NME) lati hawtirde kujeji je wangi gal laahal tawol lekki ngam aandinugo baatal mala foondoowo mbarugo viriis.
These have promising activity against a biological target related to COVID-19 disease.
Ndu ɗon yahida be kugal tawugo lekki nyau COVID-19.
At the beginning of vaccine or drug development, little is known about the safety, toxicity, pharmacokinetics, and metabolism of the NCE in humans.
Ha fuɗɗam wurtinol baatal mala lekki, wala kuje jur ɗon aandin do jam, nyaɗol, pharmacokinetikjin be noy NCE man huwan ha nder ɓaandu.
It is the function and obligation of drug development to assess all of these parameters prior to human clinical trials to prove safety and efficacy.
Lati kugal e dole nder laahal wurtinol lekki ngam larta kujeji je ɗon limti ndu fu hiddeko foondol do neɗɗo ngam jam be naffuda.

A further major objective of drug development is to recommend the dose and schedule for the first use in a human clinical trial ("first-in-human" [FIH] or First Human Dose [FHD], previously also known as "first-in-man" [FIM]).

Dabare kanduɗum ha nder wurtinol lekki lati hokkugo limtol be jaahargal hoosugo lekki man ha neɗɗo ha arandere man ("arandere-ha-neɗɗo" [FIH] First Human Dose [FHD], je ɗon no aandin bana "aranool-ha-goɗɗo" [FIM]).
In addition, drug development must establish the physicochemical properties of the NCE: its chemical makeup, stability, and solubility.
Ha ɓesdugo, wurtinol lekki sey sappina mandolji ko ɗon limti ha nder NCE: ko ɗon woni ha nder man, wondugo man, be jillol.
Manufacturers must optimize the process they use to make the chemical so they can scale up from a medicinal chemist producing milligrams, to manufacturing on the kilogram and ton scale.
Yimɓe je waɗatta lekki ndu sey huwa boɗɗum do laahal maɓɓe hiddeko wurtinugo ndu be miligamji, ha wurtinugo de kilogramji mala tonji.
They further examine the product for suitability to package as capsules, tablets, aerosol, intramuscular injectable, subcutaneous injectable, or intravenous formulations.
Fahin bo'o, ɓe larta lekki ngam dabare caahugo, bana capsolji, ɓolti-ɓolti, tuffama ha nder kuusel ɓaandu, ha nder laaral ɓaandu, mala nder lawol iyam.

Together, these processes are known in preclinical and clinical development as chemistry, manufacturing, and control (CMC).Many aspects of drug development focus on satisfying the regulatory requirements of drug licensing authorities.
Hawti, laahalji ndu ɗon aandi ha wakati hiddeko nastugo, mala wondugo ha suudu lartol bana hawtirde, taggol, be lartol (CMC).
These generally constitute tests designed to determine the major toxicities of a novel compound prior to first use in humans.
Ndu hawti fu lati lartolji ngam fammugo hallugo kuje hawtirde lekki hiddeko aranool foondol ha neɗɗo.

The Canadian government announced CA$275 million in funding for 96 research projects on medical countermeasures against COVID-19, including numerous vaccine candidates at Canadian universities, with plans to establish a "vaccine bank" of new vaccines for implementation if another coronavirus outbreak occurs.

Ngomna Kanada matini wurtinugo milionji CA$275 ngam wallugo teffolji 96 ngam heɓɓugo dabare nattinugo COVID-19, be foondolji baatal jur ha jam'iareji Kanada, be jaahargalji maɓɓitugo "siggorde baatal" ngam baatalji keese to bana nyau koronaviriis ndu lori fahin.
Clinical trial programs involve three, multiple-year stages toward product approval, and a fourth, post-approval stage for ongoing safety monitoring of the vaccine or drug therapy:
Jaahargalji foondol larni duɓɓi tati, yaɓɓordeji ɗuɗɗum gal jaɓɓol lekki, be nayaɓool, yaɓɓorde lartol do aynol baatal mala hurgol lekki:
Phase I trials, usually in healthy volunteers, determine safety and dosing.
Foondol yaɓɓorde I, ɓurna fu do yardooɓe je jammu, holla jam be limtol
Phase II trials are used to establish an initial reading of efficacy and further explore safety in small numbers of people having the disease targeted by the NCE.
Foondol yaɓɓorde II yiɗi wurtinugo aranool jaangirde naffuda e lara jam ha cakka ummatore seeɗa je ɗon mari nyau je NCE tindinni.
Phase III trials are large, pivotal trials to determine safety and efficacy in sufficiently large numbers of people with the COVID-19 infection.
Foondol yaɓɓorde III ɗon yajji, foondolji larugo ngam aandugo jam be naffuda ha cakka ummatore yimɓe ɗuɗum je ɗon mari COVID-19.
If safety and efficacy are adequately proved, clinical testing may stop at this step and the NCE advances to the new drug application (NDA) stage to begin marketing.
To jam be naffuda holli kanduɗum, lartol ha do yimɓe footi dara ha yaɓɓoorde ndu e NCE tokkan be yaɓɓorde hokkugo lekki keese (NDA) ngam fuɗɗam sippol.
Phase IV trials are post-approval trials that may be a condition attached by the FDA, also called post-market surveillance studies.
Foondol yaɓɓorde IV lati ragare foondolji je footi wona larula je larni FDA, je ewnotto bo'o ekkitolji aynol je ɓawo lumo.

In addition to the tests required to move a novel vaccine or antiviral drug into the clinic for the first time, manufacturers must ensure that any long-term or chronic toxicities are well-defined, including effects on systems not previously monitored (fertility, reproduction, immune system, among others).

Ha ɓesdugo do lartolji je ɗon emmi ngam nastinugo baatal keese mala lekki je mbardatta viriis ha nder suudu lekki ha arandere man, yimɓe je waɗatta leeki sey hallende be wakati lartama be boɗɗ, bana sababuji do kujeji feere je aandakka tawon (danyugo , nuftugo, dabare fadol, ha cakka feere'en).
In the United States, this process is called a "new drug application" or NDA.
Ha nder Lesɗe Amerika, laahal ndu ewnotto "hokkugo lekki keese" mala NDA.
A clinical trial design in progress may be modified as an "adaptive design" if accumulating data in the trial provide early insights about positive or negative efficacy of the treatment.
Foondol ha nder suudi lekki je ɗon do yahde footi saanja bana "kuje lartotto" to bana matinolji je ɗon moofta nder foondol ɗon sappina to ɗon naffa mala naffata nder hurgol.

The global Solidarity and European Discovery trials of hospitalized people with severe COVID-19 infection apply adaptive design to rapidly alter trial parameters as results from the four experimental therapeutic strategies emerge.

Foondolji Solidarity and European Discovery fu do yimɓe je ɗon wondi ha suudu lekki je ɗon mari nyau COVID-19 je ɗon nyaɗi ɗon hokka dabare lartol ngam saanjugo kujeji lartol ha wakati sappinolji dabareji amin je nay ndu ɗon wurta:

Adaptive designs within ongoing Phase II-III clinical trials on candidate therapeutics may shorten trial durations and use fewer subjects, possibly expediting decisions for early termination or success, and coordinating design changes for a specific trial across its international locations.

Dabare lartolji ha yakke foondolji yaɓɓorde II-III do hurgol foondooɓe footi usta wakati foondolji e hoosa yimɓe seeɗ tan, to footi bo'o nelda hasduji ngam darnugo law mala jallugo, be fadugo lartol saanjolji ngam ko larni foondol je feerejo ha kunde wakkereji maɗa ha do lesɗe feere.

Most novel drug candidates (NCEs) fail during drug development, either because they have unacceptable toxicity or because they simply do not prove efficacy on the targeted disease, as shown in Phase II-III clinical trials.

Foondooɓe lekki keese (NCE) ɓurna fu dara ha nder yahde maɓɓe, temma ngam ɓe ɗon nyaɗi jur mala ngam ɓe sappinatta naffuda ngam hurgol nyau ndu, bana sappini ha foondolji Yaɓɓorde II-III nder suudu lekki.

The high failure rates associated with pharmaceutical development are referred to as an "attrition rate", requiring decisions during the early stages of drug development to "kill" projects early to avoid costly failures.

Limtol darnolji do lawol je hawti be yahde lekki ɗon limti bana "jippol limtol", je ɗon mari haaje hasduji ha wakati fuɗɗam yahdeji wanginol lekki ha "mbara" ekkiltolji law ngam tato majjina ceede meere.
One 2010 study assessed both capitalized and out-of-pocket costs for bringing a single new drug to market as about US$1.8 billion and $870 million, respectively.
Wodi ekkitol feere ha 2010 je larti ceede je lutti be je wurti nder jibba ngam wanginugo lekki feere ha do lumo gal miliarji 1.8$ be milionji 870$.
A median cost estimate of 2015-16 trials for development of 10 anti-cancer drugs was $648 million.
Ceede je foondolji wurtinol lekkiji sankara 10 hoosi ha 2015-16 woni gal milionji 648$.

In a 2016 review of 106 drug candidates assessed through clinical trials, the total capital expenditure for a manufacturer having a drug approved through successful Phase III trials was $2.6 billion (in 2013 dollars), an amount increasing at an annual rate of 8.5%.

Ha 2016 lartol lekki foondooɓe 106 ha nder suudu lekkita, ceede je mo je lekki mako naffi e yardotto ha nder foondolji Yaɓɓorde hawti fu miliarji 2.6$ (ha dallarji 2018), ceede je ɗon wa'a hittande fu be 8.5%.
Seven trials were evaluating repurposed drugs already approved to treat malaria, including four studies on hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine phosphate.
Foondolji 7 ɗon no larta fahin kekkiji je yardotto no bana ɗon hurga paaɓooje, be ekkitolji nay do hydroxychloroquine mala chloroquine phosphate.
Repurposed antiviral drugs make up most of the Chinese research, with 9 Phase III trials on remdesivir across several countries due to report by the end of April.
Lekki mbardugo viriisji je lartotto ɓurna fu kanjuum on teffol Cayna woni do man, be foondolji Yaɓɓorde III 9 do remdesivir gal lesɗe jur ngam matinol ndu ha ragare Aviiril.

Led by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation with partners investing US$125 million and coordinating with the World Health Organization, the COVID-19 Therapeutics Accelerator began in March, facilitating drug development researchers to rapidly identify, assess, develop, and scale up potential treatments.

Be fadol Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation be huwooɓe je ruffi milionji US$125 million be ɗowirde Geeɓe Duniyaru do Jam Ɓaandu, Therapeutics Accelerator COVID-19 fuɗɗi ha Maars, ko wartiri teffoɓe wurtinol lekki kooyɗum ngam maandugo, lartugo, wurtinugo, ɓesda hurgolji law.
The COVID-19 Clinical Research Coalition formed to coordinate and expedite results from international clinical trials on the most promising post-infection treatments.
Clinical Research Coalition COVID-19 je wurti ngam fadugo e yaawina sappinolji diga foondolji ha suudu lekki lesdi feere do hurgolji je footi ɓuri naffugo.
In early 2020, numerous established antiviral compounds for treating other infections were being repurposed or developed in new clinical research efforts to alleviate the illness of COVID-19.
Ha fuɗɗam 2020, hawtirde lekki je mbardatta viriis jur ngam hurgugo nyauji feere lartotto malla wurtama ha nder dabareji teffol ngam nattinugo nyau COVID-19.

For an already-approved drug (such as hydroxychloroquine for malaria), Phase III-IV trials determine in hundreds to thousands of COVID-19-infected people the possible extended use of an already-approved drug for treating COVID-19 infection.

Ko larni lekki je ɗon yardi timmi (bana hydroxychloroquine ngam paaɓooje), foondolji Yaɓɓorde III-IV ɗon sappina nde temmere do temmere ha ujineji yimɓe je ɗon mari nyau COVID-19 dabare lartugo ha do lekki je ɗon aandin timmi ɗon hurga nyau COVID-19.
As of early April 2020, 103 candidate therapeutics were in preclinical or a stage of Phase I-IV development, with trial results for 29 drug candidates expected during April.
Ha fuɗɗam Aviiril 2020, foondooɓe lekki 103 wondi no ha Yaɓɓorde hiddeko suudu lekki mala I-IV, be sappinolji lartol foondooɓe lekki 29 je ɗon ndeeni ha Aviiril.

In March, the World Health Organization (WHO) launched the coordinated "Solidarity trial" in 10 countries to rapidly assess in thousands of COVID-19 infected people the potential efficacy of existing antiviral and anti-inflammatory agents not yet evaluated specifically for COVID-19 illness.

Ha Maars, Geeɓe Duniyaru do Jam Ɓaandu (WHO) fuɗɗi be "Solidarity trial" je ɗon fadi ha nder lesɗe 10 ngam lartugo ndu ha cakka ujineji nyauɓe COVID-19 footi naffuda lekki mbarugo viriis be ko footi usta gilɗiji lartakke ha jonta ngam nyau COVI-19.
Do any of the drugs reduce mortality?
Wodi gooto ha cakka lekkiji ndu ɗon usta limtol mayde na?
Do any of the drugs reduce the time a patient is hospitalized?
Wodi gooto ha cakka lekkiji ndu usta wakati wondugo nyauɗo ha suudu lekki na?
Do the treatments affect the need for people with COVID-19-induced pneumonia to be ventilated or maintained in intensive care?
Hurgolji ɗon memma yimɓe je ɗon mari COVID-19 be pneumonia je ɗon mari haje fartugo hendu mala wondi do suklare je nyaɗum na?

Could such drugs be used to minimize the illness of COVID-19 infection in healthcare staff and people at high risk of developing severe illness?Enrolling people with COVID-19 infection is simplified by using data entries, including informed consent, on a WHO website.

Irin lekki ndu footi usta nyau COVID-19 na ha cakka huwooɓe jam ɓaandu be ummatore je ɗon mari sababuji marugo nyau je nyaɗum na? Nastinugo yimɓe je ɗon mari nyau COVID-19 lati kooyɗum gal huwugo be nastirde matinolji, bana jarfuye je ɗon aandin ha do web WHO.

After the trial staff determines the drugs available at the hospital, the WHO website randomizes the hospitalized subject to one of the trial drugs or to the hospital standard of care for treating COVID-19.
Ha ɓawo to huwooɓe fammi lekki ɗon wondi ha suudu lekki, web WHO ɗon hoosa nyauɓe bana ni tan ngam gooto cakka lekki foonlji mala ha dabare hurgol suudu lekki ngam hurgugo COVID-19.
The trial physician records and submits follow-up information about the subject status and treatment, completing data input via the WHO Solidarity website.
Lekkitajo je ɗon foonda ɗon winda e hokka matinolji do nyauɗo be dabare hurgol, e timmina nastirde matinolji gal web Solidarity WHO.

A global safety monitoring board of WHO physicians examine interim results to assist decisions on safety and effectiveness of the trial drugs, and alter the trial design or recommend an effective therapy.
Kawtal aynol do jam lekkitooɓe WHO fu ɗon larta sapinolji je hiddeko ngam wallugo be hasduji be naffuda lekki foondolji, e saanja dabare foondol mala feela hurgol je ɗon naffa.

A similar web-based study to Solidarity, called "Discovery", was initiated in March across seven countries by INSERM (Paris, France).During March, funding for the Solidarity trial reached US$108 million from 203,000 individuals, organizations and governments, with 45 countries involved in financing or trial management.

Wodi irin ekkitol ndu je woni do web Solidarity, ewnotto "Discovery", fuɗɗi ha Maars ha nder lesɗe 7 gal INSERM (Paris, Faraansa). Ha lewru Maars, ceede teffol ngam foondol Solidarity yotti milionji US$108 ha yimɓe, geeɓeji, ngomna'en 203 000, be lesɗe 45 do nder ɗowirɗe siggugo ceede mala foondugo.
Numerous candidate drugs under study as "supportive" treatments to relieve discomfort during illness, such as NSAIDs or bronchodilators, are not included in the table below.
Lekki foondolji jur do ekkitol bana hurgolji "wallende" ngam ustugo mandolji ha wakati nyau, bana NSAID mala bronchodilatorji, wonday ha nder tabaalji les ndu.
Others in early-stage Phase II trials or numerous treatment candidates in Phase I trials, are also excluded.
Foondolji Yaɓɓorde II feere je fuɗɗi law mala foondooɓe hurgol ɗuɗɗum ha foondolji Yaɓɓorde I, nastay nder limgal fu.
Drug candidates in Phase I-II trials have a low rate of success (under 12%) to pass through all trial phases to gain eventual approval.
Lekki foondol ha foondolji Yaɓɓorde I-II ɗon mari limtol jallol je lessi (les 12%) ngam sallugo yahdeji foondol ngam yardugo ndu.
Hydroxychloroquine is more commonly available than chloroquine in the United States.
Hydroxychloroquine ɓuri wondugo do chloroquine ha Lesɗe America.

Although several countries use chloroquine or hydroxychloroquine for treatment of persons hospitalized with COVID-19, as of March 2020 the drug has not been formally approved through clinical trials in the United States.

Ko to lesɗe jur nastini chloroquine mala hydroxychloroquine ngam hurgol yimɓe je ɗon woni ha suudu lekki je ɗon mari COVID-19, ha Maars 2020 lekki man maray jarfuye gal foondolji ha suudu lekki ha nder Lesɗe America.

Chloroquine has been recommended by Chinese, South Korean and Italian health authorities for the treatment of COVID-19, although these agencies and the US CDC noted contraindications for people with heart disease or diabetes.
Chloroquine feelama gal arduɓe jam ɓaandu Cayna, South Korea be Italy ngam hurgol COVID-19, ko to geeɓeji be US CDC sappini feere ngam yimɓe je ɗon mari nyau ɓernde mala nyau sukar.
Both drugs have extensive interactions with prescription drugs, affecting the therapeutic dose and disease mitigation.
Lekki ɗiɗi fu ɗon mari kuɗe kanduɗum be hoosugo lekki ndu, je ɗon memma limtol hurgol be ustol nyau.

Some people have allergic reactions to these drugs.On 12 April, a preliminary clinical trial conducted at a hospital in Brazil was stopped when several people given high doses of chloroquine for COVID-19 infection developed irregular heart rates, causing 11 deaths.

Yimɓe feere, maɓɓe jaɓɓata lekki ndu. Ha 12 Aviiril, foondol hiddeko salli ha suudu lekki feere ha Brazil darnotto ha wakati je yimɓe jur hoosi chloroquine jur ngam nyau COVID-19 holli yo'o ɓernde maɓɓe saanji fi'ugo, ko waɗi yimɓe 11 mayi.
Chinese clinical trials in Wuhan and Shenzhen claimed to show that favipiravir was "clearly effective".
Foondolji Cayna ha Wuhan be Shenzhen wi'i sappinugo yo'o favipiravir "ɓuri naffugo".
Of 35 patients in Shenzhen tested negative in a median of 4 days, while the length of illness was 11 days in the 45 patients who did not receive it.
Ha nder nyauɓe 35 ha Shenzhen larti bana maray nyau ha ɓawo balɗe 4, ha wakati nde juttugo nyau man lati balɗe 11 ha kunde nyauɓe je hoosay.
In a study conducted in Wuhan on 240 patients with pneumonia half were given favipiravir and half received umifenovir.
Ha nder ekkitol feere je salli ha Wuhan nyauɓe 240 be pneumonia, reeta maɓɓe hoosi favipiravir e reeta feere hoosi umifenovir.

The term "preclinical research" is defined by laboratory studies in vitro and in vivo, indicating a beginning stage for development of a vaccine, antiviral or monoclonal antibody therapy, such as experiments to determine effective doses and toxicity, before a candidate compound is advanced for safety and efficacy evaluation in humans.
